body.p:
Greenville, Ky,
June the 22nd 1865
Thos. E. Bramlete
Govor of Kentuckey
Sir
I Have the Honor of droping you a Short address

Sir I wish to know why, Gen. D. W. Lindsey will not pay the Soldiers that was under my comd while we was on duty I was compelld to furnish my Soldiers their rations.. at my own Expence,, I all so had to furnish my men forage for their Horses all of which I have paid for Except Some five or Six Hundred dollars I Have paid for all the Horses that was musterd into the Servis of my company Except four.. Said Horses was valued and musterd Into the Servis and Rece,d, By Gen. D. W. Lindsey and orderd to actiff duty By Gen D. W. Lindsey on the 5th day of Sept 1864

) Sd.. mustein Roll (
I Have wroat to Gen Lindsey Several times Lately to which He gives no answer what Ever.. If my men ar Entitel,d, to pay I Hope you will Informe me our term of Servis Expired on the 5" day of March.. I Have asked Gen Lindsey to allow my Soldiers to Be muster,d, out and discharg,d, as other Soldiers
All of which He treates with Silent contempt or with Indiferent disrespect I Hope Govrnor I will Hear from you Soon, as I ver much neede the money I have furnished my men
Believe me to Bee with High Respect your obedt Servant

Sebastian.C.. Vick
Col 71st Reft E M 1st Bat Southern
Kentucky Bramlett guards

71
Greenville Ky
June 22nd 1865
Vick Sebastian C
Col 71st Regt E. M. 1st Bat
Southern Ky Bramlitte Guards
To the Gov

Wishes to Know why the soldiers that were under his Control are not paid says he furnished his soldiers with rations at his own expense also Forage for thier horses which he has paid for except some five or six Hundred dollars, days he paid for all the horses except four & says he asked Gen Lindsey to allow his troops to be mustered all of which he treated with Silent Contempt or indifferent disrespect &c
Respectfully referred to Maj W. H. Hays Insp Genl

D. W. Lindsey
Adjt Gen Ky
